meanings.definition: Exceeding the standard proof strength, especially in reference to alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The overproof rum was so strong that it made my eyes water.
meanings.sent2: The bartender warned us that the overproof drink was not for the faint of heart.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally added overproof alcohol to the cake, and now it's a real party treat!
meanings.sent4: The overproof scent of the whiskey filled the room, overpowering all other smells.
meanings.sent5: The overproof label on the bottle indicated it was not your average liquor.

meanings.definition: A type of rum that is stronger than the standard proof.
meanings.sent1: The overproof was a hit at the party, with guests enjoying its potent kick.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using overproof rum in my cocktails for that extra punch of flavor.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain stocked up on overproof for the long voyage ahead.
meanings.sent4: The overproof rum flowed freely at the beach bonfire, warming everyone up.
meanings.sent5: The bartender recommended the overproof for those looking for a bold drink choice.
